problem: What is the area in square units of the convex quadrilateral with vertices $(-1, 0)$, $(0, 1)$, $(2, 0)$ and $(0, -3)$?
wolframquery: Query: area of convex quadrilateral with vertices (-1, 0), (0, 1), (2, 0), (0, -3)

We can use the Shoelace Formula to find the area of the quadrilateral. Labeling the vertices in order as $A=(-1,0)$, $B=(0,1)$, $C=(2,0)$, and $D=(0,-3)$, we have:

\begin{align*}
\text{Area} &= \frac{1}{2} |(x_Ay_B + x_By_C + x_Cy_D + x_Dy_A)\\
&\quad - (y_Ax_B + y_Bx_C + y_Cx_D + y_Dx_A)| \\
&= \frac{1}{2} |(-1)(1) + (0)(2) + (2)(-3) + (0)(-1)\\
&\quad - (0)(-1) - (1)(2) - (0)(-3) - (-3)(-1)| \\
&= \frac{1}{2} |(-1) + (-6) + 3 + 0 + 0 + 2 + 0 + 3| \\
&= \frac{1}{2} |1| \\
&= \boxed{\frac{1}{2}}.
\end{align*}
